definition.name: get-cmake
definition.description: Installs CMake and Ninja, and caches them on cloud based GitHub cache, and/or on the local GitHub runner cache.
definition.author: Luca Cappa https://github.com/lukka

inputs.name: cmakeVersion
inputs.description: Optional CMake version, expressed with the semantic version syntax, e.g. '~3.25.0' for the most recent 3.25.x, `ˆ3.25.0` for the most recent 3.x version, or a specific version `3.25.2'. Or `latest` or `latestrc` for the latest stable or release candidate version. If not specified the `latest` is installed.

inputs.name: ninjaVersion
inputs.description: Optional Ninja version, same syntax as `cmakeVersion` input. If not specified, `latest` is installed

inputs.name: useCloudCache
inputs.description: Optional argument indicating whether to use the cloud based storage of the GitHub cache. Suited for the GitHub-hosted runners.

inputs.name: useLocalCache
inputs.description: Optional argument indicating whether to use the local cache on the GitHub runner file system. Suited for the self-hosted GitHub runners.

outputs.name: cmake-path
outputs.description: The path to the installed CMake executable

outputs.name: ninja-path
outputs.description: The path to the installed Ninja executable

evidence.reasoning: This action installs and manages dependencies (CMake and Ninja) required for building projects, and it caches them for efficiency. The focus on managing versions and caching aligns it closely with dependency management.
